ygData.subject: Re: Geez!
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve read all your messages since I got on this list, and so far nothing you have stated has come from any of the game designers, programmers, or developers.
ygData.messageBody:
I've read all your messages since I got on this list, and so far nothing you
have stated has come from any of the game designers, programmers, or
developers. I remember your rotten letter before you supposedly quit, I read
your apology and promise to provide information in the future, and I've read
you flaming other people for being down on you and I never said a thing about
any of it until now...because now you are making these absolute and unequivocal
statments about how there is no 3rd book etc. and I'm simply not going to
believe it just because you say it. Nor am I going to believe it because you
say that some GM says it, and the reason for that is because we have already
gotten conflicting statements from GMs! One says tinkering is fine, another
says it is broken, someone else says there is a 3rd book and yet another source
says there isn't. I still say nothing that comes from a Guide or even a staff
GM means anything...good or bad.
If you took what I wrote as a flame maybe YOU should re-read what I wrote
instead of automatically going into defenseive mode.

Joshua Bednarz wrote:

> From: "Joshua Bednarz" <thewhitemage@...>
>
> GM's are told stuff. Guides are volunteers, but GMs are people that work
> actually in the Verant building, they know whats going on. They work at the
> building, answering petitions and get payed for it. It is part of thier job
> responsibilities to know what is going on, so that they do NOT give false
> information. Now...if you didn't read the message I sent here about that
> earlier, then you don't even have a right to be flaming me.
>
> >How do you know Josh? Are you one of Verant's game designers, planners,
> >programmers, or developers? Are you related to any of them and they have
> >told
> >you this is a fact? Or are you as ignorant as the rest of us and just
> >going by
> >what someone told you?
> >There are enough rumors and disinformation about the 3rd book, collapsible
> >fishing pole, and fireworks going around that I wonder if anyone on any
> >server
> >really has solid information. Until I recieve some word by an Everquest
> >programmer or developer I'm keeping my mind open.
> >Don't count any information you have been told by the guides or GM's as
> >factual. None of them created this game.
>
>
